Censorship must be “holistic” , says Imtiaz Ali

Film-maker Imtiaz Ali believes censorship in India needs to be holistic and should consider restrictions on every medium of communication through which one can access censored content. He was responding to a question on whether India’s censorship policy takes away the audience’s liberty to choose the movie they want to watch at the Kolkata Literary Meet on Friday.

“If there is free flowing information, let’s say on Torrent, on the Internet and I can get to see anything, then to be stopped from watching it in a movie will discourage me from going and watching that movie,” he said. — IANS
title: Censorship in India needs to be holistic: Imtiaz Ali
